definition: to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to start a new life/to make a fresh start
to do a favor to sb

sentences.english: Being a man without ideal, what are the differences between you and salted fish.
sentences.chinese: 做人要是沒有理想，那和鹹魚有什麼區別呀？

sentences.english: My life is very simple low-key man Frank Gao Biao in real good.
sentences.chinese: 我的生存法很簡單高標處世低調做人坦誠真實多好啊。

sentences.english: These eight virtues are the foundation of being a person.
sentences.chinese: 這八個字是做人的基礎，你們不要把它忘記。

sentences.english: Love is a great teacher, teach us to turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 愛是一位偉大的導師，教我們重新做人。

sentences.english: After released from prison, he was determined to turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 出獄後，他決心洗心革面，重新做人。

sentences.english: Without our stories, we can no longer become human beings.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有了我們的故事，我們就不再會做人。

sentences.english: Be good in the future, and you will be happy forever.
sentences.chinese: 將來好好做人，那麼你就會永遠快樂。

sentences.english: He often tells his disciples to subdue other by virtue.
sentences.chinese: 先生經常教育弟子在做人上要以德服人。

sentences.english: Chinese young people do not lack for sources of advice on how to behave, pointed out Mr.
sentences.chinese: 張銳說，中國年輕人並不缺乏做人準則的教育。

sentences.english: Kindness, righteousness, propriety , wisdom and trustworthiness. These five virtues should be strictly adhere to and should not be violated.
sentences.chinese: 仁義禮智信是做人的五條準則，必須遵守，不容紊亂。

sentences.english: God sent representatives and told them to teach the people to be more than people.
sentences.chinese: 神派出代表們讓他們去教導人們要不僅只做人。

sentences.english: This is a new project to help ex-prisoners turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項皆在幫助出獄的犯人重新做人的新計劃。

sentences.english: One shouldn't be too snobbish, as snobs are hated by all people.
sentences.chinese: 做人不能太勢利眼了，嫌貧愛富的人讓人痛恨。

sentences.english: He had the decency to admit his error.
sentences.chinese: 他承認了自己的錯誤，真是會做人。

sentences.english: Small study of Confucius, the great benefit the children learning to be human.
sentences.chinese: 從小學習孔子，對孩子們學做人大有益處。

sentences.english: Boss: Keep a low profile, you ll have larger space to develop yourself.
sentences.chinese: 做人要低調，這樣你纔有更大的空間去發展。

definition: to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2
